item.title: ‘Stand Up’: With One Maneuver, Trump Tries to Box In Democrats
item.description: President Trump turned his State of the Union address into full-blown political theater, handing out medals to war veterans and tossing the spotlight to ice hockey players.
item.dc:creator: Shawn McCreesh

item.title: Rubio Was Looking at His Phone After Trump Praised Him in State of the Union Speech
item.description: Shortly after Secretary of State Marco Rubio was singled out for praise, a New York Times photographer captured him reading messages from Mr. Trump’s special envoy to Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Julian E. Barnes
item.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
item.media:description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio reading messages on his phone during President Trump’s speech on Tuesday.

item.title: 6 Takeaways From Trump’s State of the Union
item.description: In an address that was heavy on theatrics, President Trump lashed out at Democrats as “crazy” and unpatriotic.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Pager and Luke Broadwater
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:description: President Donald J. Trump delivers the first State of the Union address of his second term on Tuesday night.

item.title: The World Waited on Edge for Trump’s Thinking on Iran. It’s Still Waiting.
item.description: Even as the president considers an attack, his State of the Union address offered little more than a brief repetition of vague talking points from recent days.
item.dc:creator: Anton Troianovski
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:description: Gen. Dan Caine, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, left, and other military leaders listening to President Trump deliver his State of the Union address in the Capitol on Tuesday.

item.title: Abigail Spanberger, in Democratic Response, Asks if Trump Is Working for Americans
item.description: “We all know the answer is no,” the Virginia governor argued in her rebuttal to President Trump’s State of the Union address.
item.dc:creator: Reid J. Epstein

item.title: In Address, Trump Calls for More Limits on Trans Youth
item.description: During the State of the Union address, the president said states “must ban” social transitions among young people without parental consent.
item.dc:creator: Amy Harmon
item.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
item.media:description: Sage Blair, middle, was recognized by President Trump during his State of the Union address on Tuesday.

item.title: Trump’s State of the Union Speech: Full Transcript
item.description: President Trump spoke for nearly two hours to a joint session of Congress.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:credit: Demetrius Freeman for The New York Times
item.media:description: President Trump’s speech was broadcast live on a television in a cafeteria at the Capitol on Tuesday night.

item.title: Democrats, Boycotting Trump’s Speech, Rally Outside the Capitol
item.description: Dozens of House and Senate members skipped the speech and, in a counter event on the National Mall, criticized the president’s policies on immigration, health care and the economy.
item.dc:creator: Megan Mineiro
item.media:credit: Caroline Gutman for The New York Times
item.media:description: The People’s State of the Union on the National Mall in Washington on Tuesday night.

item.title: “That is our highest honor, congressional medal of honor — that’s a big thing”
item.dc:creator: John Ismay

item.title: Trump Gives Out Awards, Including Presidential Medal of Freedom, at State of the Union
item.description: The president announced medals for the U.S. men’s hockey team’s star goalie as well as several military veterans.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Ahn
item.media:description: Members of the U.S. men’s hockey team in the House chamber at the Capitol on Tuesday night.

item.title: “His reckless trade policies have forced American families to pay more than $1,700 each in tariff costs.”
item.dc:creator: Linda Qiu

item.title: “They’ve killed and maimed thousands of American service members and hundreds of thousands, and even millions, of people with what’s called roadside bombs, they were the kings of the roadside bomb. We took out Suleimani. I did that in my first term, it had a huge impact. He was the father of the roadside bomb.”
item.dc:creator: John Ismay

item.title: “We have almost no crime anymore in Washington, D.C. How did that happen? In fact, crime in Washington is now at the lowest level ever recorded, and murders in D.C. this January were down close to 100 percent from a year ago.”
item.dc:creator: Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Eileen Sullivan

item.title: “In a breakthrough operation last June, the United States military obliterated Iran’s nuclear weapons program with an attack on Iranian soil known as Operation Midnight Hammer.”
item.dc:creator: Julian E. Barnes

item.title: “With our new military campaign, we have stopped record amounts of drugs coming into our country and virtually stopped it completely coming in by water or sea — you probably noticed that.”
item.dc:creator: Julian E. Barnes

item.title: “We have more jobs, more people working today than ever before in the history of our country.”
item.dc:creator: Linda Qiu and Ashley Cai

item.title: “The cheating is rampant in our elections. It’s rampant. … They want to cheat. They have cheated. And their policy is so bad that the only way they can get elected is to cheat and we’re going to stop it.”
item.dc:creator: Reid J. Epstein

item.title: “I ended eight wars.”
item.dc:creator: Linda Qiu

item.title: “I want to stop all payments to big insurance companies and instead give that money directly to the people so they can buy their own health care, which will be better health care at a much lower cost.”
item.dc:creator: Sheryl Gay Stolberg

item.title: “We are deporting illegal alien criminals from our country at record numbers and we’re getting them the hell out of here fast!”
item.dc:creator: Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Ashley Cai

item.title: “We will always protect Social Security, Medicare, Medicaid.”
item.dc:creator: Margot Sanger-Katz

item.title: “The cost of chicken, butter, fruit, hotels, automobiles, rent is lower today than when I took office, by a lot. And even beef, which was very high, is starting to come down significantly.”
item.dc:creator: Colby Smith

item.title: “Under my just-enacted most favored nation agreement, Americans who have for decades paid by far the highest prices of any nation anywhere in the world for prescription drugs will now pay the lowest price anywhere in the world for drugs anywhere.”
item.dc:creator: Margot Sanger-Katz

item.title: “With the great Big Beautiful Bill, we gave you no tax on tips, no tax on overtime and no tax on Social Security for our great seniors.”
item.dc:creator: Linda Qiu

item.title: “Under Biden and his corrupt partners in Congress and beyond, it reached a breaking point with the green new scam, open borders for everyone. They poured in by the millions and millions from prisons, from mental institutions. There were murderers, 11,088 murderers.”
item.dc:creator: Jazmine Ulloa

item.title: “If we’re able to find enough of that fraud, we will actually have a balanced budget overnight.”
item.dc:creator: Linda Qiu

item.title: “So in my first year of the second term — should be my third term.”
item.dc:creator: Reid J. Epstein

item.title: “American natural gas production is at an all-time high because I kept my promise to drill, baby, drill.”
item.dc:creator: Lisa Friedman

item.title: “I believe the tariffs, paid for by foreign countries, will, like in the past, substantially replace the modern day system of income tax — taking a great financial burden off the people that I love.”
item.dc:creator: Alan Rappeport

item.title: “But when it comes to the corruption that is plundering America, there has been no more stunning example than Minnesota — where members of the Somali community have pillaged an estimated $19 billion from the American taxpayer.”
item.dc:creator: Jazmine Ulloa

item.title: “100 percent of all jobs created under my administration have been in the private sector.”
item.dc:creator: Colby Smith

item.title: Al Green Once Again Disrupts Trump’s Speech After Protest
item.description: The 79-year-old Texas Democrat was escorted out of the House chamber after holding up a sign that read, “Black people aren’t apes!”
item.dc:creator: Robert Jimison
item.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
item.media:description: Al Green held a sign that read “Black People Aren’t Apes,” as President Trump delivered the State of the Union address at the Capitol on Tuesday.

item.title: “I’ve never seen a goaltender play as well as goalie Connor Hellebuyck. Think of it. 46 shots on goal.”
item.dc:creator: Julian E. Barnes

item.title: “After four years, in which millions and millions of illegal aliens poured across our borders totally unvetted and unchecked, we now have the strongest and most secure border in American history by far. In the past nine months, zero illegal aliens have been admitted to the United States. But we will always allow people to come in legally. People that will love our country and will work hard to maintain our country.”
item.dc:creator: Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Ashley Cai

item.title: “When I last spoke in the chamber 12 months ago, I had just inherited a nation in crisis with a stagnant economy, inflation at record levels, a wide open border, horrendous recruitment for military and police, rampant crime at home, and wars and chaos all over the world. Tonight after just one year, I can say with dignity and pride that we have achieved a transformation like no one has ever seen before. A turnaround for the ages.”
item.dc:creator: Linda Qiu and Ashley Cai

item.title: “Last year, I urged this Congress to begin the mission by passing the largest tax cuts in American history, and the Republican majority delivered so beautifully!”
item.dc:creator: Linda Qiu

item.title: “In four long years, the last administration got less than $1 trillion in new investment in the United States. And when I say less, substantially less. In 12 months, I secured commitments for more than $18 trillion pouring in from all over the globe.”
item.dc:creator: Linda Qiu

item.title: “In one year, we have lifted 2.4 million Americans, a record, off of food stamps.”
item.dc:creator: Linda Qiu

item.title: “As thousands of new businesses are forming, factories, plants and laboratories are being built, we have added 70,000 new construction jobs in just a very short period of time.”
item.dc:creator: Alan Rappeport

item.title: “The Biden administration and its allies in Congress gave us the worst inflation in the history of our country. But in 12 months, my administration has driven core inflation down to the lowest level in more than five years.”
item.dc:creator: Colby Smith

item.title: How Trump’s State of the Union Speech, Longest in History, Compares to Other Presidents
item.description: State of the Union speeches. Here’s how he compares to past presidents.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Ahn and Ashley Cai

item.title: U.S. Sent F-22 Fighter Jets to Israel, Official Says
item.description: Videos show a dozen F-22 Raptors left Britain on Tuesday, and flight tracking data indicates they flew toward the Middle East.
item.dc:creator: Christoph Koettl, Aaron Boxerman, Sanjana Varghese and Eric Schmitt
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

item.title: Kash Patel’s Olympics Trip Left Plenty of Time for Leisure, Schedule Shows
item.description: An itinerary for Mr. Patel’s trip provides more granular detail, including long segments of personal time that suggest he was not immensely oversubscribed by official duties.
item.dc:creator: Glenn Thrush
item.media:description: Kash Patel, the F.B.I. director, watching the United States and Canada in the gold medal hockey game at the Milan Olympics.

item.title: How The Times Reports on the State of the Union
item.description: A team of more than 50 journalists, including eight photographers, will cover President Trump’s address.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Bahr
item.media:description: The U.S. Capitol on Tuesday, hours before President Trump was to deliver his State of the Union address.

item.title: Here’s the latest.
item.dc:creator: Luke Broadwater, Carl Hulse, Shawn McCreesh and Katie Rogers

item.title: Same War, Different Message: Trump Tonight vs. Biden Four Years Ago
item.description: President Trump issued no statement in support of Ukraine on the anniversary of the Russian invasion, four years after his predecessor laid out the stakes.
item.dc:creator: David E. Sanger
item.media:credit: Mauricio Lima for The New York Times
item.media:description: Hundreds of Ukrainian soldiers’ graves in Lviv, Ukraine, on Tuesday.

item.title: 68% of Americans Say Trump Has the Wrong Priorities
item.description: As Mr. Trump prepares for his State of the Union address, polls show that most Americans say he isn’t paying enough attention to the country’s biggest problems.
item.dc:creator: Ruth Igielnik
item.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
item.media:description: President Trump speaks with the press before departing from the South Lawn at the White House last week.

item.title: Senate Democrats Again Block D.H.S. Funding, Demanding Enforcement Curbs
item.description: Democrats refused to allow a bill to reopen the Department of Homeland Security to move ahead without new restrictions on federal agents carrying out President Trump’s immigration enforcement drive.
item.dc:creator: Catie Edmondson
item.media:description: Federal agents confronting protesters in Minneapolis last month.
